page.title: 05Claines CE Primary School
page.content:
Dating back to the 1840's, when it was establish as a National School, the school occupies original buildings plus some more recent additions. It is a school without a village roud it, the actual centre of Claines comprising the Church, the 'Mug House' public house and the school. The Northern Link road is carried in a cutting between the school and the Church. The school currently has 192 children aged between 5 and 11 years with Head plus 6 teachers. It draws children from a wide area. Children leave either at 9 to go to Droitwich or at 11 to go to Worcester schools. It is a Controlled school but maintains close links with the Church.
The collection of data for this project has been undertaken by the staff and pupils at Claines School.
